learning_outcomes: Identify equivalent sets.
Identify subsets and use the subset symbol "⊂".
Apply sets to solve problems in real life situations.
Read and write numbers up to 1 000 000 000.
Express a number in expanded notation.
Add whole numbers with sums up to 1 000,000.
Apply addition to solve problems in real life.
Subtract whole numbers up to 1 000 000
Apply subtraction and addition to solve problems in real life.
Multiply numbers by 10, 100 and 1000 using short multiplication.
Multiply two and three by two digit numbers using vertical multiplication.
Apply the properties of zero (0) and one (1) in multiplication.
Apply multiplication to solve problems in real life.
Divide numbers by 10, 100 and 1000 using short division.
Divide two and three digit by two digit numbers using long division (with remainders).
Apply division to solve problems in real life.
Identify patterns and complete number sequences.
Describe equivalent fractions.
Arrange the common fractions either in ascending or descending order using proportion line.
Identify and represent improper and mixed fractions.
Convert mixed fractions to improper fractions and vice versa.
Add and subtract proper, improper and mixed fractions with common denominators.
Apply improper fractions to solve problems in real life.
Describe an angle.
Identify types of angles.
Use a protractor to measure and draw angles up to 180°.
Draw a rectangle and square using protractor and set square.
Identify isosceles and equilateral triangles.
Draw the equilateral and isosceles triangles using protractor and set square.
Determine duration of time elapsed between events.
Relate seconds, minutes, hours and day.
Illustrate the meaning of area.
Describe standard units to measure area. (cm², mm², m²).
Derive the formulae for finding area of rectangle and square.
Find the area of a rectangle and square.
Illustrate one-to-many relation using arrow.
Apply relations in real life situations.
Read and interpret line graphs.
Collect and present data on a line graph.
